column3: > The `libc++` link in in the OP goes to the `libstdc++` manual.\n\nThanks! Fixed.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #22336 by kiminuo
* #20744 by fanquake
* #10102 by ryanofsky

If you consider this pull request important, please also
Oh, this function is just a convenience. It's easy to drop it (or provide a workaround).
Does it still make sense to document the minimum libc++ of 7.0? See #22324
> Does it still make sense to document the minimum libc++ of 7.0? See #22324\n\nRight! Wiil re-open and update accordingly.

The commit message here needs changing. It mentions #21365 and requiring P0083R3, which is no-longer true, as that change has been reverted. It also doesn't change "minimum supported compiler versions", it's adding a note about `libc++`.
Most Clang usage will still be on top of libstdc++, and it's still possible to compile master with Clang 5 and libstdc++ 7+. i.e on Bionic.
> ... libstdc++ 7+. i.e on Bionic.\n\nTo be precise, [7.5.0](https://packages.ubuntu.com/bionic/libstdc++-7-dev).
> with Clang 5 ... on Bionic.\n\nDo you mean [clang 6.0](https://packages.ubuntu.com/bionic/clang)?
> Do you mean clang 6.0?\n\nNo. I mean [clang-5.0](https://packages.ubuntu.com/bionic/clang-5.0).
